text.title: On One Problems of Spectral Theory for Ordinary Differential Equations of Fractional Order
text.author: Temirkhan Aleroev
text.head: 2. Results
text.p: Reference studied the operator in the spacevwhich was first considered in References, where and is the Green function of the following problem S (with ):

In particular, in this paper, we provide very important proof of the completeness of the system of eigenfunctions and associated functions in of the operator for based on fact that the operator of fractional differentiation is sectorial and for (this fact plays a main role in solving boundary value problems for advection-diffusion equation of fractional order by the method of separation of variables since we can write out both the exact solution in the form of an infinite series by eigenfunctions and the approximate solution replacing the infinite sums by sums of the first n terms), a proof based on the well-known Livshits theorem (researching of case for published in this paper firstly):Theorem 1 (Livshits).

p.hi: If – is a limited kernel and “real part” of it is non-negative kernel, then the inequality is hold

where —is the characteristic numbers of kernel K. The system of main functions of the kernel K is complete in domain of values of the integral operator if and only if, when there is an equal sign in inequality above.

text.p: In his paper M. M. Dzhrbashian wrote, that “the question about the completeness of the systems of eigenfunctions of the operator or a finer question about whether these systems compose a basis in , has a certain interest but its solving is apparently associated with significant analytic difficulties”. The questions of the completeness of the systems of eigenfunctions and associated functions for similar problems were studied by A. V. Agibalova in. Undoubtedly, we shall note the fundamental results of M. M. Malamud and L. L. Oridoroga obtained in this direction. In (see also), using the theorem of Matsaev and Palant, it was established that the system of eigenfunctions of the operator is complete in . And this fact used by M. Ali, S. Aziz and S.A. Malik in their paper.

As noted above, in this paper, a similar result was obtained using the well-known Livshchits theorem. The following proof of the completeness of the system of eigenfunctions is simpler than the previously presented proofs, which makes the results of this paper very significant.

text.p: Now we give the main result of paper.Theorem 2.

p.hi: The system of eigenfunctions and associated functions of the operator , where , is complete in .

text.p: We denote the kernel of as . In the authors have proved that this kernel is non-negative by the following way: Let us rewrite as
Clearly, for , the kernel of is non-negative.

By the same way, we may show that the kernel for adjoint operator
is non-negative too. Thus is non-negative. Let us show that the following expression holds
If is eigenvalue of the operator , then complex conjugate is eigenvalue of the operator too. Thus
So, taking to account lemma 1, we obtain that the system of eigenfunctions and associated functions of the operator for , is complete in . □Remark 2.

text.p: For the kernel of the operator is not fixed-sign, thus we cannot use the Livshits theorem, used above. To prove the formulated theorem, let us consider the value of the the form . Let us introduce the following designation
